CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph!

In this paragraph, there are several mentions of different materials, which we can identify as "Material Name" entities. Here are the ones I found:

1. PffBB-10: This is mentioned several times in the paragraph as the material used for the active layer in the device. Therefore, it can be considered as a "Material Name" entity.
2. decyl-substituted PffBB-10: This is a modified version of PffBB-10, where decyl (a type of alkyl group) has been substituted. This modified material is used in the device and is mentioned in the paragraph.
3. V oc: This stands for "open-circuit voltage" and is a measure of the maximum voltage that a solar cell can achieve when there is no load connected to it. It is mentioned in the paragraph as a value of 0.93 V for the device using PffBB-10.
4. J sc: This stands for "short-circuit current" and is a measure of the maximum current that a solar cell can achieve when there is no resistance in the circuit. It is mentioned in the paragraph as a value of 14.62 mA cm^-2 for the device using PffBB-10.
5. FF: This stands for "fill factor" and is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell. It is mentioned in the paragraph as a value of 60.44% for the device using PffBB-10.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PffBB-10
2. decyl-substituted PffBB-10

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-10 |
| decyl-substituted PffBB-10 |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph!

Based on the context of the paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities that can be identified:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) - This is the entity mentioned in the first sentence of the paragraph, and it refers to the percentage of incoming sunlight that is converted into electrical energy.
2. V oc (Open Circuit Voltage) - This is the entity mentioned in the second sentence of the paragraph, and it refers to the maximum voltage that the solar cell can achieve when there is no load connected to it.
3. J sc (Short Circuit Current) - This is the entity mentioned in the third sentence of the paragraph, and it refers to the maximum current that the solar cell can achieve when there is no load connected to it.
4. FF (Fill Factor) - This is the entity mentioned in the fourth sentence of the paragraph, and it refers to the ratio of the product of the J sc and V oc to the product of the V oc and the active layer thickness.

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

PCE, V oc, J sc, and FF.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant "Property Name" entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) - This refers to the percentage of incoming sunlight that is converted into electrical energy.
2. FF (Fill Factor) - This refers to the ratio of the product of the short circuit current and the open circuit voltage to the product of the open circuit voltage and the active layer thickness.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| FF (Fill Factor) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc .

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph!

In this paragraph, there are several properties of the device that are mentioned, which can be considered as "Property Values". Here are the entities that I identified:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): This is the percentage of incoming sunlight that is converted into electrical energy by the device, and it is denoted by the symbol "PCE". The value mentioned in the paragraph is 8.22%.
2. V oc (Open Circuit Voltage): This is the maximum voltage that the device can achieve when there is no load connected to it, and it is denoted by the symbol "V oc". The value mentioned in the paragraph is 0.93 V.
3. J sc (Short Circuit Current): This is the maximum current that the device can supply when there is no load connected to it, and it is denoted by the symbol "J sc". The value mentioned in the paragraph is 14.62 mA cm^-2.
4. FF (Fill Factor): This is a measure of the efficiency of the device, and it represents the ratio of the active material area to the total area of the device. The value mentioned in the paragraph is 60.44%.
5. Spin-coating temperature: This is the temperature at which the active layer of the device is coated, and it is denoted by the symbol "T". The values mentioned in the paragraph are 80 °C, 60 °C, and 100 °C.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): This is the percentage of incoming sunlight that is converted into electrical energy by the device, and it is denoted by the symbol "PCE". The value mentioned in the paragraph is 8.22%.
2. V oc (Open Circuit Voltage): This is the maximum voltage that the device can achieve when there is no load connected to it, and it is denoted by the symbol "V oc". The value mentioned in the paragraph is 0.93 V.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
